Vocabularies.Definition: v.    take quickly or roughly  一把抓住； 抢；夺
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A bird had snatched up the snake from the ground and then dropped it on to the wires.
e.g.  I gave the loose tooth a tug.

Vocabularies.Definition: become unsteady; fall 失去平衡
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She swung around, almost losing her balance.

Vocabularies.Definition: 突然离去，溜走；（飞机）起飞
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The plane eventually took off at 11 o'clock.

Vocabularies.Definition: with maximum power, energy or noise 全速地；大力地；极响地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Do you really need the heater on at full blast?
e.g.  He stooped to look under the table.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.    weak; fragile 弱的；脆弱的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His frail hands could hardly hold a cup.

Vocabularies.Definition: in touch with 与……有接触
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He was in direct contact with the kidnappers.
e.g. As soon as I get through with my work I'll join you.

Vocabularies.Definition: come out quickly or suddenly 突然出现（或冒出） pop v. move rapidly and unexpectedly 突然地活动
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Suddenly she popped out from behind a bush.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. put furniture in 为（房子）配备家具
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The room was furnished with the simplest essentials: a bed, a chair, and a table.

Vocabularies.Definition: turn (electric current) on 接通（电源）；打开
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He switched on the light at the wall socket.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. fall in small drops 滴； 滴下
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Water is dripping from that leaky faucet.
e.g.  Everyone made a dash for the nearest exit.
e.g.  We have a lot in common.
e.g.  I caught hold of my glasses before they dropped to the floor.

Vocabularies.Definition: show good manners; be polite 懂礼貌；讲规矩
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Did Peter behave himself while I was away?

Vocabularies.Definition: in the back (of) 在……的后部
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Musicians played at the front and rear of the procession.
